args: *yaaawn* Not much left on our scouting\ntrip to-do list, huh? What an adventure,\nthough! I've learned so much.
No kidding. I've learned how exhausting it\nis traveling with you.
Whâ€”hey! It's not MY fault all these places\nhave such interesting local customs.
You really seemed to enjoy each stop\nalong the way, Sarisse.
I've also seen more facets of the other\ncities of the northern continent. It's\nbeen fun. So, um... Thank you. So much!
Aw, thank YOU, Noelle! We wouldn't have\nmade it anywhere without you to guide us.
That's my job. So, um... To get back\nto that for a moment, we should, er...\nWe should really hurry through this area.
Th-the Lashtern region sees a lot of\nfighting among the small city-states\njockeying for dominance.
Travelers have to watch out for former\nmercenaries or soldiers from fallen\nstates that have turned to b-banditry.
That's what the guys following us are up\nto?
Tch... Guess they're on to us.
Did you really think sylvan ears wouldn't\npick up on you stomping around like that?
Feh. I'm mostly thinking there's only\nthree of you.
They're clearly trained fighters.\nTh-they must be ex-soldiers!
So they were just normal soldiers whose\ncountry got taken over? Why attack US,\nthen?
As if you'd understand. An honest man\nwith no country's got no way to live.
But we've still got families.\nMouths to feed...
I'll take dishonor before I let them starve...\nShame that means you lot have to die\ninstead!
...Huh? I'm okay. Why am I okay?
A dragon? Hey, I know you! You've\nbeen to the Halidom a few times,\nright? Your name was...
AC-011 Garland of Pravda's Air Force, sir.\nPleasure to see you again, Master Luca.
G-Garland! Oh, thank you so much!
Pravda? *spit* You're not dragons, you're\nhyenas. Sticking your noses into other\npeople's wars... Here to finish us off?
No. I saw this altercation happening\nand intervened to protect Miss Sarisse.\nBut that is not what brings me here.
I come on orders from Pravda\nHeadquarters to speak with you all.
With us? What are you lot scheming?
Pravda is not engaged in any scheming,\nsir. We wish only to see Lashtern freed\nfrom its long history of violence.
And just how do you propose to do that?
The nation responsible for your homeland's\ndestruction is expanding at a rapid rate,\nabsorbing all neighboring lands by force.
We seek an alliance among the remnants\nof those fallen lands to stop them before\nwar consumes the entire continent.
So... He wants to join up with these guys\nto help them win a rematch against the\npeople who took their country?
Y-yes. Pravda is an independent group of\ndragons working to end war through their\nown methods.
I, um... I believe they've entered the\nconflict here in Lashtern in hopes of\nbringing peace to the region.
Then isn't this a huge opportunity for\nthese people? If they win, they could\nretake their homeland!
Lashtern has long been a prosperous land,\nbeloved by dragons... We've lived our\nwhole lives with reverence for their kind.
But not Pravda. Not after you lot violated\nthe rule that true dragons hold fast.
What, the old rule that said dragons\nshouldn't directly intervene in human\nconflict?
Yes... North Grastaea is the birthplace of\nthe Ilian Church. Many of the people here\nstill cling to the old ways quite fiercely.
To those people, Pravda abandoning their\nrule seems like, um... Like someone\nabandoning their own faith.
Anyone who would spit on something\nbequeathed to them by their ancestors\nis no dragon.
Their kind are beasts, and nothing more.
Hey now! Do you really have to put it\nlike that?! I'm sure Garland and his\nteam have their reasons! He'sâ€”
Why are you stopping me?! I'm not just\ngoing to let him badmouth you, Garland!
I fear there is little you or I could say\nto change his mind.
One cannot expect the ancient traditions of\na land to be rewritten overnight. Nor does\nanyone have the right to do as much.
Hmph. If you knew that much, why bother\ncoming at all? All you animals know is\nhow to crush the opposition by force.
Okay, THAT is just... AAARGH! I'm done!\nI am about to LOSE IT with this guy!
Have you lost your mind, woman?!
You take it back! Everything you said\nabout Garland, take it back right now!
Why should I mince words to spare\nthe feelings of a girl from a country\nin league with Pravda?
I've seen dozens of people cherishing\ndozens of different cultures. I learned\nfrom themâ€”laughed and cried with them!
What matters most to a person depends on\nwho they are. On their race, on where they\nwere born. That's your right! But...
But anybody who trash-talks another\nperson's beliefs without even TRYING\nto understand them is wrong. PERIOD!
Sh-she does have a point... It isn't right to\nreject others without knowing anything\nabout them.
The reason Garland cast aside the old rule\nhas n-nothing to do with power or faith.\nIt was a sincere, principled choice.
Y-yes. Garland and the other dragons of\nPravda are troubled by the North's long\nhistory of war and violence.
Some people may say they only want to\nrule by force, but...they're just trying\nto protect their homeland.
Miss Noelle... I am both humbled and\njoyed beyond words by your understanding.
And to you, people of Lashtern... I will not\nask for your understanding. Only know that\nI cannot bear to see this land suffer so.
In times past, it was home to the beautiful\nriver Lena, to the Scarlet Forest and its\nmagnificent pines...
Now the forest stands in ash. Burned, the\nday our kingdom fell. And now it's the Lena\nthat runs scarlet with my people's blood.
So...you see them, too.\nThe same painful sights.
...Fine. Garland, was it? I rescind my\nprior comment. You're not a beast.
Really?! I mean, thank you! Ha ha.\nIt turns out you're actually a good guy,\nmister!
Tch. Drop the friendly act.\nI didn't say I'd work with them.
No, and that's fine! You took the first step\ntowards understanding, though. And that's\na beautiful thing.
Step one is learning about each other's\nvalues and beliefsâ€”each other's culture!\nIf you don't make that first effort...
Ahhh, it's so warm here! I didn't mind the\nair up North, but I'm definitely a Southern\ngirl at heart.
Garland! It's been a minute. How are\nthings back in Lashtern? Any progress?
Indeed. We have been in talks with the\nremnant forces. It seems a formal\ncooperation agreement is forthcoming.
Really? That's great! I'm so glad they were\nwilling to listen.
Credit for that is entirely yours. I fear I had\naltogether abandoned hope of swaying\nthem from the old ways.
Aw, c'mon! All I did was give him a left\nhook to the ribs...
And yet your form was pristine. I have\nnever seen a body blow of its like. Might\nI inquire after your training regimen?
Ah... Ha ha... Yeaaah, that's just a little\nhabit I picked up from hanging around my\nidiot brother. It's basically reflex by now.
She really is incredible. Look how friendly\nshe is with Garland already. And I hear\nshe made quite the impact up North.
She probably gave that poor guy a hairline\nfracture... I feel like that trip aged me by\na decade, easy.
But it did get me thinking. The way she\nthrows herself into things headlong's what\nlets her cross cultural divides so easily.
That naive curiosity'd probably let her\nmake friends just about anywhere in the\nworld.
Ha ha. I don't doubt it for a second.\nShe just may go on to shape the future\ninto something truly remarkable.

Something you or I couldn't even
imagineâ€”a world where kindness and
naive curiosity quell the fires of conflict
before their first embers ever spark to life.
